title: Diffraction: A New Approach
summary:
A phenomenological model of hard diffraction is presented, in which the
structure of the Pomeron is derived from the structure of the parent hadron.
Predictions for diffractive deep inelastic scattering are compared with data.

Abstract. A phenomenological model of hard diffraction is presented, in which
the structure of the Pomeron is derived from the structure of the parent hadron.
Predictions for diffractive deep inelastic scattering are compared with data.

proportional to the corresponding F2 structure functions of the proton,

trajectory at t=0. In the Q2 range of 10-50 GeV2 , where the DDIS data are concentrated,
these measurements yield λh ≈ 0.3. Using these values we obtain n = 0.4 and m = 0.7.
